intro: Lavrania haagnerae, commonly known as the Haagner's lavrania, is a rare and unique flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is adapted to the specific microclimates of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and ecological specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
